# CFWriteStreamOpen(_:)

**Function**

Opens a stream for writing.

## Declaration

```swift
func CFWriteStreamOpen(_ stream: CFWriteStream!) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **stream**: The stream to open.

## Return Value

`true` if `stream` was successfully opened, `false` otherwise. If `stream` is not in the [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFStreamStatus/notOpen] state, this function returns `false`.

## Discussion

Opening a stream causes it to reserve all the system resources it requires. If the stream can open in the background without blocking, this function always returns `true`. To learn when a background open operation completes, you can either schedule the stream into a run loop with [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFWriteStreamScheduleWithRunLoop(_:_:_:)] and wait for the stream’s client (set with [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFWriteStreamSetClient(_:_:_:_:)]) to be notified or you can poll the stream using [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFWriteStreamGetStatus(_:)], waiting for a status of [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFStreamStatus/open] or [doc://com.apple.corefoundation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CFStreamStatus/error].

## Opening and Closing a Stream

- **CFWriteStreamClose(_:)**: Closes a writable stream.
